title: Kindred's Great, But...
body: Anyone else feel like they don't belong in Runeterra? I mean, yes, obviously their art design and such are different than usual, but that's not what I'm talking about. Rather...I don't feel like they're a part of the established universe. There's nothing in them that connects to the greater story. It's basically another Bard; a cool character, but not one I care that much about figuring out because I don't think they're a part of Runeterra's story.

Well, I like the idea that she's a folktale because, if she was "I'm a genuine thing everyone knows exist and isn't just make believe cause I am in all history books," it takes away from her being something of an enigma.

We no longer have the Institute of War.  If we did, then a being like Bard, a celestial who can travel throughout the cosmos, altering the flow of time and space to prevent apocalyptic events wouldn't exist.  I mean, he could, but then he'd be a champion for the IOW who is controlled by the summoners...

Why would he subject himself to that or allow it?  Either his power is nerfed, or the summoner's get super buffed.  Only other explanation is that he descended from the heavens, offering himself.  At that point "Why?"

Same goes for Kindred.  She would either be captured and locked into fighting for the summoners, or she would need some mysterious circumstance.

I don't think it's a good thing to have characters be an enigma. In order for me to relate to a character, or even just have an opinion on them that isn't based on art or kit design, I have to know something about them, and 'WOOO~ it's MYSTERIOUS' is just a cop out. I mean, at least we know more about Kindred than Bard (they're a death spirit of some sort that split itself in two for someone to talk to.)

Actually,a character being an enigma or a mystery is fine so long as it comes with progression,development & reveals.Especially when you 1st meet the character.Because as you progress through the story,you learn more about them & the mystery turns into understanding.

Problem with League & Lore,there is very little progression or developments.We have no idea when or if we will learn more about Kindred than what is initially released.That is the problem with the "I'm a mystery" champs who just have a giant question mark on them when released.We don't know when we'll get more,so we want to a good amount before we get sent into the desert.
(For those who don't understand,this is an analogy I use for the lore.I represent the initial lore released with "Champ X" as a bottle of water & I represent the time between lore releases for/involving "Champ X" as the interval between you drinking the last of your initial water & you finding more.)

Back to my point about progression.While Bilgewater was a very good step in the right direction,they're nowhere near solving the issue of LOL's Lore lack of progression & development.Had this been less of an issue,I'm sure champs surronded in mystery at 1st would be less of an annoyance.
I suppose that's the biggest issue. In order to get more content about the mysterious champs, I have to wait until the next lore release...and who knows when that's gonna be.

The 'why' can make for a good story. Gods/super beings brought down to mortal standards can be an interesting means to see how they react and what they do without their powers. Sandman, Illyria in Angel, Tyrael, etc are examples of essentially a god brought to their knees and having to talk to mortals at their level.

Kindred is that thing no one wants to discuss. Death.
The incarnation of death is not seen. It is whispered about.
You don't really considered the "grim reaper" to have an actual connection to the world do you?
Kindred is as old as the first life technically (pre split included). Where there is life, there must be death. Death as a being is an abstract concept used to explain why we die. Therefore that is what Kindred is. Kindred=Death in Runeterra.
Though there is lore in the world about death (talking about our world for a second) we don't really know why it truely exists. Therefore it is kind of this veiled mystery. What is the reason for death, what happens when we die, what happens after we die. Kindred just so happens to be a real part of Runeterra that was never really proven as such until now.

But if they have no connection to the world and no one likes to talk about it, then why should we care about them as characters?

Several authors have managed to make Death a character, either likable or not. There's no reason that Riot couldn't do the same.

The character is part of a culture, just as Tahm Kench and even Bard and Aatrox are. You cant have mythology without characters and you cant have culture without some added mythology in it, otherwise its shallow and not realistic.

Thats how mythology works, to explain certain forces and fenomena in the world, you create characters to represent those things. Those characters and the story behind them (which are usually shaped by natural forces or stories by experience) create the mythology which in a sense also enriches the culture of certain groups of people. All of it is intertwined.

Is Bard even mythological? Like, both Tahm and Aatrox have some sort of relation to the world; people know they exist. But Bard (and as far as I can tell, Kindred) seem entirely unrelated; it's entirely possible that Kindred is just a mythological creation that Riot made playable, and they don't exist in Runeterra. I mean, probably not, but it's possible.

I'm inclined to agree with this.  Kindred's really cool and all, but he's two things I'm leery of:  Indefinably powerful, and totally disconnected. But with Bard, and now Kindred, we're essentially getting gods.  Even the top tier champions on the power rosters of yore can't hope to stand up to these guys lore-wise, but we still don't really know how they fit in anywhere.  They're just there for the sake of being there.
